abstract: A New York appeals court agreed with a lower court that only a defendant could challenge a search warrant, and then only during a hearing before a trial.
snippet: A New York appeals court agreed with a lower court that only a defendant could challenge a search warrant, and then only during a hearing before a trial.
lead_paragraph: A New York state appeals court ruled on Tuesday that Facebook had no legal standing to challenge search warrants on behalf of its customers, a decision that dealt a blow to civil libertarians and social media companies seeking to expand Internet privacy.

headline.main: Facebook Loses Appeal on New York Search Warrants
headline.print_headline: Facebook Loses Appeal on Its Challenge of New York Search Warrants
